reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDITED 24/05/15
I bought this game fairly early on before the dev kind of revamped it (from an almost empty plains type map with a few buildings to an almost empty forested valley with a few buildings).
It's a game riddled with problems currently (primarily because it's so far off a full game) so I wouldn't recommend it how it is right now, but the dev does seem to be updating the game fairly frequently which I gotta admit, isn't something I see as much as I'd like.

+++
- Frequent updates from a developer who appears to be very much still involved in the game.  **Edit 24/05: The developer hasn't updated the game in over a month now, and the rumours about it being a bit of a ruse that is mostly likely just a quick cash grap appear true - until this is proven otherwise DON'T waste the pittance this 'game' costs - because it's not worth even that.**
- While there are a lot of bugs currently, they are slowly being fixed.
- You can hear your footsteps when you're driving ala Flintstones.
- While the driving feels like the cars weigh the same as a small child, there's at least driving in it that works (and you can now reverse in them! The joys.)
- Thirst and hunger don't seem to plummet too fast currently (although because of what you're limited to doing in the game this wouldn't be a massive issue anyway).
- If you want to trip your t#ts off just drive off the end of the road and become one with the  abyss.

---
- Due to the present state of the game there really isn't a whole lot to do but walk about (more on the walking later) and have a nosey inside buildings.
- The walking pace feels like you're being sucked into tar, it's painfully slow, though there isn't much to see at the moment so whether that's a good thing I'm not sure.
- There is a sprint function (shift), but just don't press A or D thinking it will make you turn or strafe because currently all the left and right keys do is slow you down to a snail's pace and stop you sprinting.
- Lots of errors* and crashes seemingly induced by walking in the wrong direction or looking at grass wrong.
- You can't seem to store food currently so you have to just stuff it in your face the minute you find it.

*I don't know why it breaks, I'm not a learned person, I don't understand game bugs and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•. But the game likes breaking currently. A lot.

Overall I don't see this game as a waste of my money (emphasis on the my) but I currently only load it up about once a week just to see how it's coming along. It has very little in the way of replayability and in my opinion I'm a bit baffled as to why it's on Steam in its current state. I understand the whole Early Access thing but there just doesn't seem to be enough substance currently for it even to be early access.
That's just my opinion though. I don't think this will ever be one of those great, memorable games but it has the potential to at least be enjoyable if the dev keeps plugging away like they have been doing.
I may give it the ol' Caeser thumbs up once there's more to it.

After hauling logs into the settlement it started getting dark, For fear of change I tried climbing into the attic of a house. I glitched up the ladder somehow and sat there for a bit. After listening to holws over and over along with Russian chants I was freaked out. On day three I found the construction site and made it my goal to build my house. After three days in game, crapping my pants, and building a house here I am. Overall 4/10. The game needs obvious improvement but for what it's worth I think It's interesting.
